guides.title: UNOFFICIAL: Cannot reactivate - Decommissioned at other location

steps.description:
This pack was decommissioned at another location and can only be reactivated at that location.

Are you aware whether this pack has been decommissioned on your behalf by the wholesaler or pharmacy you received it from?

steps.questionTitle: Packs that have been supplied in one location may only be reactivated in the same location.
steps.description: If you tried to reactivate the pack due to a procedural error, please document the root cause of the alert in NMVS Alerts. Once documented, the investigation is complete and the pack may be returned to saleable stock.

If the pack was decommissioned at the location you borrowed it from, you cannot reactivate it. If possible, ask the location you borrowed it from to reactivate it, but that can only be done within 10 days of the pack getting decommissioned. If you are certain that the pack was previously decommissioned at another location due to a procedural error, please document the root cause of the alert in NMVS Alerts. Once documented, the investigation is complete and the pack may be returned to saleable stock.
Please set this pack aside and contact IMVO for assistance.

steps.questionTitle: This pack has already been decommissioned.
steps.description: Set the pack aside and contact SMVS GmbH for help with this alert. SMVS GmbH will need to run a pack audit trail for this pack to check the history of the pack because this is an uncommon alert.

guides.title: UNOFFICIAL: There is a mismatch between the data scanned from the pack barcode and the data held in the SMVS database.

steps.questionTitle: Check for manual data entry or barcode issues
steps.description:
Manual entry: If you entered the
data manually, rather than scanning the pack, check that the data entered
matches what is printed on the pack. If not, then type it again correctly. If
the pack is successfully verified and decommissioned after repeating the manual
entry attempt, the investigation is complete.



2D barcode: Check if there is a
linear barcode close to the 2D barcode on pack. If you suspect your scanner
might have scanned the two barcodes at the same time, try covering the linear
barcode with your thumb and scan the 2D barcode again.

Has a root cause been found at this stage?

A verification scan of the pack should be undertaken to determine if the corrective action has been successful. If the verification scan is successful, the pack may be returned to saleable stock. If your FMD software told you that ‘an alert has been raised’, please document the root cause of the alert in NMVS Alerts. Once documented the investigation is complete.

Check NMVS Alerts for
SMVO/MAH feedback. If you can see from NMVS Alerts that the root cause
has been established by the MAH (or SMVO) and the alert has been resolved, no
further alert action is required by you. A verification scan of the pack should
be undertaken to determine if the corrective action has been successful. If the
verification scan is successful, the pack may be returned to saleable stock. 

Has a root cause been found and corrected?
A verification scan of the pack should be undertaken to determine if the corrective action has been successful. If the verification scan is successful, the pack may be returned to saleable stock.

Scanned data:  If you scanned the 2D barcode and the pack data does not match the on-screen data, you may have a misconfigured scanner. If you believe that your scanner is configured incorrectly, go to IMVO’s scanner help web page here and follow the troubleshooting steps provided:

- Follow the ‘Check your scanner’ and ‘Fix your scanner’ guidance

- Test your scanner using EMVO's scanner test tool  

FMD software: Check the pack data on your FMD software. If the data on screen appears to be mixed up (e.g product code appears in the batch or serial number) and you have seen the same data mismatch issue with several different packs, you may have a software issue. Please contact your FMD software provider for assistance.

Has a technical error been found and corrected?

A verification scan of the pack should be undertaken to determine if the corrective action has been successful. If the verification scan is successful, the pack may be returned to saleable stock. If your FMD software told you that ‘an alert has been raised’, please document the root cause of the alert in NMVS Alerts. Once documented the investigation is complete.

Set the pack aside and contact SMVO for assistance. If your FMD software tells you
that ‘an alert has been raised’ please document your investigation and the
source of the pack in NMVS Alerts.
